column1: terrific start for Finch! Brings out the perfect on drive, it's full and straight from Woakes, slotted straight of mid-on
drags the length back, at off stump, defended to mid-off
short, some width outside off, and that's hammered square of the wicket wide of point...Finch is off and running in some style
straighter line, back of a length, knocked towards mid-on...he's keen for a single but it's not on
full at off stump, 138kph, defended on the front foot
back of a length, on middle and off, defended to the leg side...confident start from Finch
starts with a bouncer! 140kph/87mph, well directed over off stump, Warner has to be alert to sway out of the line
goes fuller, back of a length at middle, takes the splice of the bat as Warner is slightly hurried
did cover get a hand on that?! A short, wide delivery, Warner plays square and can't keep the ball down, Morgan flies high to his right but it's just fingertips to it
short of a length at off stump, 141kph/87mph, defended on the back foot

got him! The short ball gets Warner...this is a beauty from Wood. Short of a length at 142kph/88mph, climbs sharply, Warner taken by surprise, and takes the splice of the bat, loops into the slips where second gets around for a simple catch. The impact of pace
short of a length outside off, 145kph/90mph...first time been able to say for an England bowler in a while, played square into the off side
short of a length, angled down the leg side, glances wide of a diving Buttler...fine leg does very well to flick it back. Well, looks like that took the face of the bat. Buttler got a glove to it
short of a length outside off, punched from the back foot to mid-off
good length at off stump, defended to mid-off
short outside off, Finch keeps finding the middle, driven square through the covers off the back foot...Woakes hasn't quite settled yet
full and straight, defended to mid-on
too straight, flicked off the pads to long leg
back of a length, at middle and off, worked behind square with a closed face
short outside off, 144kph/89mph, Finch goes for the pull and is well beaten for pace over the top edge
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler...for the second time Wood loses his footing in his follow through
at off stump, 141kph/87mph, defended to the on side
good length outside off, takes a thick outside edge but safely into the ground wide of second slip
big appeal for lbw! This nips back a touch from outside off, takes him on the back leg...might have been an inside edge. No bat...umpire's call for impact and going over
short of a length, pushed down the leg side
full at off stump, 139kph/86mph, defended to the off side
short of a length, takes the bottom hand off the bat as he plays to the leg side
he's jumping across the crease, gets a leading edge to the off side as he aims to tuck a straight ball to the leg side
nicely bowled, back of a length outside off, nips back at Finch who defends to mid-on
touch of extra bounce, he's back in the crease and this takes the splice to jar the bat
inside the line, works a back-of-a-length delivery behind square on the leg side
full at off stump, driven back past Wood who is sprawling on the pitch once again...yet he still tries to stick out his left hand to stop the ball
he's over again, this delivery is work from outside off behind square
a sharp bouncer whistles over Finch's head as he makes a last-minute decision to bail out of a pull
fuller, defended to the leg side
short outside off, this time he makes a good connection, a flip-pull over square leg...excellent timing and placement
back of a length, wide outside off, played square to cover
short of a length at off stump, he's across the crease and works off his hip to long leg
full outside off, the bat twists a little as he drives to mid-on
brilliant shot! Just short of a length, Smith onto it in a flash, pulls from outside off through midwicket
fuller, again taken through the leg side, a bottom-handed shovel out to deep midwicket
outside off, full, driven to backward point
full, wide, a slower delivery...stand and deliver from Smith as he flays it through the covers. Woakes has been inconsistent
back of a length outside off, pushed to mid-off
that's a ripper! Short of a length at off stump, bounces sharply and straightens off the seam to square up Finch and beat the top edge
defended on the back foot to the bowler
very wide on the crease, good length outside off, left alone
a straighter delivery, good length, pushed into midwicket
good length at off stump, 140kph/87mph, tucked round the corner to long leg...another good over from Wood
short of a length, strikes Finch a blow as he aims to work to the leg side...straight on the glove!
full outside off, onto the front foot and drives to cover
back of a length, straight, worked into midwicket and that's excellent running
gets forward and drives to mid-off
worked off the pads to short fine leg
back of a length outside off, defended
flicked off the body to fine leg
full at off stump, Finch back in the crease, knocks to the leg side
off a short run! (He had to abort the first attempt as Smith wasn't ready) And it didn't really work...it's a low full toss, a bit of a freebie, flicked through midwicket
flicks a full delivery from off stump through square leg
that does him for pace, 146kph/90mph, pulled without really knowing about it behind square
short of a length outside off, defended towards mid-on...Finch wants the run but Smith says no
touch short, whipped out to deep midwicket
angled down the leg side, he goes for a dab-sweep, doesn't make contact, rebounds off Buttler's gloves
short again, pulled to deep backward square leg
uses his feet, this drifts outside leg stump, pushed into the on side
short on leg stump, think Smith was trying to leave this for the wide but it takes his body
this one is way down the leg side

he's got Smith! What a strike for Rashid. Gets it outside off, just a hint of turn, and a thin nick to Buttler. He actually played outside this, away from his body, and got an inside edge. Not sure Buttler took it entirely cleanly, but it stayed in
beats him straightaway! Adjust to the left hander, pushed across him, may have been the googly, Head's feet not going and he fiddles at it
short of a length outside off, cut through point wide of third man
full outside off, onto the front foot and punches to cover
that's a lovely stroke, picks up a short-of-a-length delivery and plays a short-arm jab/pull shot over midwicket
edged! Through the vacant slip cordon. A good length ball outside off, it wasn't a deliberate glide from Finch
touch of extra bounce outside off, jabbed into the off side
back of a length outside off, played to cover
flicks a full toss down to long-on
down the leg side again, Finch gets a tickle on it fine of the keeper
very full, wide outside off, mistimed back to the bowler off the toe end
that's a bit of a heave...a full delivery outside off, swung through midwicket
full at middle and off, tucked to midwicket
full outside off, that's a strong shot from Head as he reaches out and drives between cover and mid-off
beaten outside off as he aims to drive on the up
width outside off, he throws his hands through a drive which lobs in the air over the infield to the sweeper
back of a length outside off, punched from the back foot to cover
very full outside off, 136kph/84mph, driven to mid-off
pulls the length back, at off stump, defended to the bowler
down the leg side

dragged on! We saw a few of those in the Test match here. Good length, outside off, aiming to play square through the off side and gets a bottom edge into the timber. The seventh ball of the over proves a bonus for England!
outside leg stump, the line has been inconsistent so far, flicked to short fine leg

huge appeal for lbw! Not sure he picked the googly. Morgan has called the review. Gets forward, spins past the bat and front pad. Actually takes the back leg. And it's done too much, missing leg stump
full and straight, defended on the front foot
more air, tossed up at off stump, punched firmly to mid-on who makes a good save but is deep enough for the single
a little shorter, played off the back foot, gets an inside edge into his boot
full outside off, driven firmly to cover
short of a length outside off, driven square to point where it's smartly intercepted
short, he plays back, a defensive shot runs into the leg side
angled into the pads, doesn't get any bat on it as he looks to flick and it bobbles behind square
short delivery, at the body, deflects off the glove wide of the keeper...he was trying to get out of the way of that.
back outside off, short of a length, pushed to point
full at leg stump, sweetly timed through the leg side, deep square gets across
full length, outside off, dabbed to gully
tossed up and sublimely swatted through square leg! Plants the front foot, sweeps with authority and that was nailed
outside off, cut firmly into the off side
tossed up, under the eyeline, driven carefully to mid-off
a decent legspinner on middle and off. A solitary slip is still in attendance
forward and patted to cover
tucked to the leg side, back in the crease
slices a cut through backward point
nurdled round the front pad, out to backward square
forward and this one turns a touch to beat the edge. Tight line
tapped into space, down the ground
flicked in the air, through midwicket, and up comes an effortlessly fluent fifty for Aaron Finch. It's been tough going out there, but he's made it look easy
smashed up and over long-on! Not really timed, nor to the pitch of the ball. But all levers and power!
forward, poked back down the pitch
tapped down the ground to long-on
worked into the covers
worked into the gap on the off side
firmly swept, but well intercepted on the 45
forward and punched to the off side
short cover in business once again as Marsh looks to work the single through the off side
on the back foot, mid-on gathers to join the dots
high-elbowed push down to long-off
twirly length, on off stump
pre-meditated retreat to leg, to free up the off side with a hefty calve. Not entirely timed, but placed well enough to return for the second
smashing drive, but smashed straight to mid-off. Very full length, inviting the stroke
back of a length this time, jabbed out to point
driven in the air, but just out of reach of short cover! Looked like a slower ball, and nearly did the trick
slides down leg
on the back foot, defended back to the bowler
nudged to the leg side
pops up a touch into the leg side, but always safe
punched back past the bowler
a patient poke into the off side, treating Moeen with respect
blocked under the eye-line, Moeen gathers
chopped into space at point
low full toss and dropped! That was pounded straight back at Moeen, who barely had time to react. Four runs (and the umpire) saved
onto the front foot once more
angled into the pads, half an appeal from Plunkett, but the real drama is between the wickets - Marsh wants the single, gets sent back, and wears a shy on his back as he makes his ground
squared up on the back foot
slower ball, on the pads, tucked square
short and sharp, a swishing pull finds nothing but air
defended on the back foot, a sharply taken single to mid-on
flicked off the toes, out to backward square leg
nurdled off the front pad
tucked to the leg side
back and across, punched into the covers
panned into the stands! Tossed up, Marsh's eyes light up, aims dead straight, with a full swing of the bat, clean over the bowler's head and onto the sightscreen
stabbed to cover
worked back to the bowler
tucked off the pads to leg
short again, a rolled pull out to square leg
on the back foot, a decent leg-sided lifter, and a stolen run as Woakes pursues to gather
back of a length, and battered through midwicket! Stunning timing, but Woakes' length is not right for his pace today
chopped out to point
on the pads, nudged to the leg side
looped up, on off stump. Blocked
retreats to leg to flog through the off side, but short cover gathers
flicked off the hip to short backward square
more spin, cracked to Morgan at short cover, who gathered in one movement and so nearly pulled off the shy! Marsh dives for safety
defended into the gap
high elbow, tight line, good tidy over
sliding into the pads, deflected into space on the leg side
on the back foot, nudged into the leg side
rolled wrists, down to third man
terrible line from Woakes, full length, aiming down the leg side, and helped on its way with a casual flick
back of a length, fenced through the vacant cordon to third man
onto the front foot, blocked to cover
on the back foot, gathered well with a dive at mid-on
whittled down to long-on for another single
blocked into the leg side
another deflection into the leg side
spanked hard and long, into the leg side, but the sweeper tidies up
tucked to leg again but another sharp tumbling stop at mid-on. A decent over in the end
swept, and nailed. Too straight, and dabbed fiercely through backward square
on the pads again, and another good single as short midwicket swoops
short, and carved to deep point
on the legs, nudged behind square
looped up on off stump, and blocked
chiselled down to long-on, a good recovery from Rashid after a first-ball four
nudged into space
flicked off the front pad, another couple through the leg side
worked to leg once more
eased through long-on for another single
milking it through the leg side once again
gentle turn into the pads, Australia content to settle for the singles right now
as if to prove the point, the first ball of the last 20 overs is a massive tonk, flat over midwicket! Lots of bottom hand, and general humpty, to greet a half-tracker
stretching forward, blocked on the front foot
flicked through the leg side
panned once more! Looped up, dipped late, Finch danced into position, and pongoed through the line of the ball, over long-on!
on the back foot, quicker and flatter, and poked to cover
swept hard, but backward square makes it two dots in a row, which helps rescue an expensive over
pushed to the off side
huge appeal but England have no reviews! Looked like a bottom edge, but actually was the pad flap. A good decision
nurdled to the leg side
makes room, and cuts into the covers
shorter, helped round the corner with a cross bat, but short backward square is in business again
keeps the strike with another nudge to leg
tossed up and blocked on the front foot
pounded into the stands for his ninth ODI hundred! Right in the slot for a bottom-handed biff, high and mighty over wide long-on! Tremendous power and a mighty innings
nudged to leg
worked round the front pad, behind square
clipped off the pads to the leg side
crunched down the ground! No footwork, who needs any when the bat is swinging that freely! Australia are on the march now...
clubbed into the leg side, not entirely timed
pushed to mid-on, off the back foot
clipped through leg once more
stands firm on the back foot to punch into the covers
solidly into line to block, that's a tidy over
back of a length, takes the thigh pad to the leg side
well bowled, nips back from a good length, defended to the off side
straight, on a good length at 140kph, played back to the bowler
another good one, angles back considerably from outside off, short of a length, beats Marsh for pace and takes him high on the back leg...deflects towards backward point
a short ball is compactly pulled to long leg
a bouncer, over middle and off, 143kph/88mph, Marsh sways out of the line...good comeback over from Wood
backs away alongside leg stump to open up the off side, then misses
picks out deep midwicket! Stands still this time, opts for the leg side, heaves across the line and clubs it down the throat of Bairstow
works a straighter delivery off the pads to the leg side
pushes a shorter delivery straight of midwicket
full at off stump, defended on the front foot to cover
good end for Moeen, full outside off, blocked to cover
wide on the crease again, speared in at the stumps on a full length, squeezed into the leg side
well bowled, delivered from mid-crease, short at off stump at 143kph, jumps and defends down by his feet
just gets the line wrong this time, short on the hip, pulled fine of long leg...brings up Australia's 200
fuller, worked into square leg
some late shape in at Marsh, full at off stump, driven to mid-off
good length at off stump, pushed into the point area and takes him to a 66-ball fifty
out of the front of the hand, full and straight, pushed to midwicket
through him! Nicely done from Rashid. Another one that goes straight on, Marsh giving himself a touch of room, misses the drive and the ball tickles leg stump
full at middle and leg, comes forward and defends
driven into the covers
tossed up, a googly, driven off the inside half of the bat to the leg side
and this one isn't far from being dragged on, wider outside off, Paine aiming to drive through the covers and gets a bottom edge
back of a length, straight, nudged into the leg side
back of a length, outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man
short of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
fuller, at the pads, clipped through square and placed nicely between deep square and long leg
fuller outside off, pushed into the covers
pushed square towards point and can't find the gap this time
gets down early and sweeps a full delivery off the stumps to long leg
another wrong 'un, Paine prods forward with uncertainty
opens the face and pushes square into the off side
uses his feet, makes it into a full toss and swings it over wide long-on...he has such power
back outside off, drives to deep cover
full at leg stump, nudged to midwicket
short of a length, gets inside the line and pushed square on the leg side
short of a length outside off, angled to third man
full, wide outside off, he goes for the drive and it skews in the air for a while but safely down to third man
short, angling down the leg side, pulled to long leg
full outside off, a slower ball, tapped towards point and Stoinis wanted the run but he was quickly sent back
good length at off stump, pushed to the on side and Woakes fields it himself
back of a length at off stump, dropped into backward point
hops across the crease and takes this from well outside off to deep square
full outside off, driven firmly to cover
some late swing in, full at the stumps, driven back to the bowler
and now a short one outside off at 142kph/88mph, beats the top edge as Stoinis tries to go up and over
top shot! Excellent piece of timing and placement, gets forward into a full delivery outside off and drives it perfectly between cover and mid-off
some width outside off, cut over backward point and wide of third man
short of a length, straight, pushed down the ground to long-on

full outside off, driven very firmly back at Plunkett who takes most of the pace of it but no one can stop the single as the ball scuttles behind him...well, well it got back to Plunkett on the full so technically a drop
a slower ball outside off, a big wind up from Stoinis and he's beaten by the change of pace
there's that power again, a fraction short from Plunkett, he sees the length so early and pulls over midwicket
full outside off, another slower one, driven into the covers
short outside off, and he's cut it over the off side almost for six! What a stroke that is. For a moment looked like he might pick out deep cover, but he placed it perfectly
short of a length, goes for the pull and gets an under edge into his crease
short of a length outside off, 142kph/88mph, he's across his crease and defends
a touch fuller but he again opts for the cross-batted shot, pulled without much timing to deep midwicket
short run up again...good length outside off, guided to third man
a low full toss, full and straight, pushed through the leg side, splits long-on and deep midwicket
pulls a short ball between deep square and long leg...Australia's 250 up, can they find another 50?
a slower ball into the pitch, clubbed over wide mid-on and it scoots away from the chasing fielder
short again, and almost six! Gets the hook shot away, not completely in control, but places it between the two men in the deep
pushes the length up on off stump, Paine sends it back to the bowler
a slower ball, very slow at 98kph, short outside off, he manages to carve it out to deep cover
full, pushed with a straight bat down the ground
short of a length, nudged into midwicket, Woakes sets after it to make sure there isn't a second
full outside off, a slower ball, angled to third man
goes for the yorker, it's a low full toss and it's hammered straight of mid-off
short of a length outside off, square drives wide of the cover sweeper
full, wide outside off, driven to cover on the edge of the circle
a short ball, Paine had started to come at the bowler, pulls to short fine leg and is annoyed at not finding the gap
goes over the off side, not quite out of the middle this time, lands short of the cover sweeper
good length, straight, drilled down to long-on
swings across the line of a back-of-a-length ball and finds deep square
low full toss on the pads and how's that for some whippage! Sends it rocketing behind square, no chance for the man in the deep, and that's a fantastic 37-ball fifty
a slower ball down the leg side, extra ball and extra run
that's big! Gets underneath a full delivery, perhaps an attempted yorker, sends it straight down the ground over the sightscreen
goes for the yorker and this one is on target, driven down to long-on
finds mid-off! Back of a length, aiming to club it down the ground, doesn't get the elevation and Root grabs it coming forward
short of a length, takes an inside edge into the body and bobbles to the off side
drags a back-of-a-length ball from outside off to long-on who does well to stop the second
beats him with a back-of-a-length slower delivery, he was aiming square through the off side
that's a big full toss, straight, pushed into the covers...below waist height, so not a no-ball
he's move all around his crease here, looking for a scoop, Woakes cleverly fires it wide outside off...and excellent umpiring not to call that wide, have to give the bowlers something
gives himself room outside leg stump and then goes over the off side
moves miles outside leg, Wood follows him, gives no room, and it's fended into backward point
gets a bottom edge as he swings to the leg side, dribbles behind him through his legs...ah, not quite through the legs! Rebounds off a delicate area. Ouch
short of a length, heaved through the leg side
short, pulled in the air towards fine leg, where Rashid doesn't judge it very well, doesn't start running forward to make the catch, but still stops the boundary
short again, crunched through the leg side, almost finds the gap but Hales does superbly to flick it back
swing a miss to the leg side, short of a length ball, last over starts with a dot

well judged on the rope! As calm as you like from Moeen. A short ball, goes for the pull, gets a top edge, Moeen, at deep backward square, is in the shadows which are starting to come across the ground but knows exactly where the rope is and pouches the catch
he's moving around the crease, and then fails to back contact with a back-of-a-length ball. Another dot
that helps...gets a top edge as he swings across the line of a short delivery, goes straight back over the keeper. Takes Australia to 300
this is a long way up...and taken at long on. Jason Roy runs in, steadies himself, and makes no mistake. Cummins aiming to clear the leg side, got too much height and not enough distance

and he gets a boundary, because the fielder at deep midwicket committed to trying to make the catch! Heave into the deep, Bairstow went for the catch, the ball fell in front of him, then couldn't stop it
down the leg side, a bit of swing and a good pace though
thuds into the pad as Roy struggles to work it into the leg side
tight off-stump line, blocked back down the pitch
another scramble as the ball deflects into the leg side
superb bowling, a late inswinging yorker, impressively dug out in the end, but not a lot to do to that ball but survive
defended on the back foot with high hands
smashed through the covers! It had been a fine over, but just a hint of width to finish it, and Roy took full advantage
on the hips and nudged into the leg side
short and smashed, hard across the line, clean through midwicket. Top boshing, with a short-arm jab
on the pads once more, dabbed fine to backward square leg
on the back foot, leg-sided, nudged to mid-on
driven with hard hands, off a fat inside-edge, and that's a fierce shy from fine leg, that all but pings the stumps at the non-striker's end. That would have been tight, and probably terminal
drilled down the ground, through long-on. Power-packed
defended into the leg side
fully into line and blocked back down the pitch
short, and a steepling top-edge, high and mighty over the keeper's head! Plops onto the sightscreen, and though the runs keep flowing, Australia aren't unhappy to see Roy beaten for pace
on the pads, too straight, flicked fine. He's flying!
panned over the covers! Leaning into the stroke, flogging the hands through the line, another stunning strike
punched straight to mid-off this time. And breathe
tucked into the leg side
short, leg sided, and swatted over fine leg with the nonchalence of a cow flicking its tail at a fly!
what utter timing! On the pads, clipped sweetly through the gap at midwicket, and it races all the way once more!
tighter line, on the off stump, and Roy squares up to defend
too much width outside off, and Roy flogs on the up through the off side, not quite timed, but placed beyond the ring, so perfectly safe
a swing and a miss! Shorter, wider, no contact this time
big appeal, but that looks to be going over as Roy is pinned on the line of leg stump
short-arm jab, back through the line of the ball. Pinged through mid-on with the rigid timing of a perfectly played table cricket shot
short and wide, and called as such
beaten all ends up this time! But the ball rears from a good length, takes the splice, and loops safely into no-man's land behind gully!
edged and gone! A tame end for Bairstow - good line outside off, extra bounce, and a loose tickle through to the keeper. Very Vince in the Ashes, that dismissal
cramped on the back foot, poked back down the pitch
short, and slapped through wide long-on as Hales instantly shows how he intends to play this one...
stout defence on the front foot
pushed into the covers, well fielded
solid areas, outside off, and pushed back down the pitch
on the toes, clipped with sweet, sweet timing once more through the leg side, two men give chase and just about haul it back inside the rope
short, and a miscued pull, as Hales ducked into his pull as he realised he'd been beaten for pace. A simple catch pops up to short midwicket, and Australia are very much in the hunt now...
outside off, dabbed into the covers with a very straight bat
squared up on the leg stump, Roy stabs a drive back to the bowler
on the pads and worked into the leg side
defended on the back foot, solidly into line
battered hard over long-on! Just a touch too short and pounded to keep his innings ticking
very full length, wide outside off and left alone
that is a punishing straight drive, but straight at the non-striker's stumps! Great shot for no reward
worked into the off side
good delivery, wide of off stump and exploding off the seam with good shape away from a loose drive
that's a crunching straight drive, using the pace, meeting it with a vertical bat, and all the way to the rope to get off the mark
on the toes and punched to cover
pushed into the cover
on the toes, worked into the gap with a roll of the wrists
punched into the covers, off the back foot
good skiddy wicket-to-wicket fare, pushed into the off side again
blocked from a tight middle-and-leg line
outside off, through to the keeper, good aggressive pace
wanders across the stumps to manipulate an angle on Tye's probing line and length, another extraordinary stroke, timed once more through midwicket, and there's his fifty from 32 balls!
punched with lots of bottom hand to cover
squared up on off stump and defended back down the pitch
clipped firmly through square leg, and Root is picking up his tempo now. Placed ideally into the gap
clipped to the leg side
jabbed through third man
short, outside off, through to the keeper
width, slashed, edged, four! A calculated risk on this occasion, no slips, so he needed only to get it past the keeper, which he most certainly did!
tight line, back of a length, cut firmly to third man
good change-up from Tye, a slower ball that hops through to the keeper
on the toes, worked round the corner
wafted into the leg side
up onto the toes, punched to cover
whittled off the pads, into the leg side
wicket to wicket, drilled off the back foot to the bowler
flicked on the up, into the leg side
angled into the gully
attempted yorker, well watched and dug into the leg side
worked into the leg side
short and hoisted behind square with a roll of the wrists
stabbed down to third man
good full length, blocked back down the line of the ball
driven into the covers as Tye keeps his pace mixed up at all times
pumped straight, into space behind the bowler, and tidied up at mid-on
opens the face in an attempted glide, but can't beat the cordon
good chance of pace as Root is forced into a late adjustment on off stump
an ambitious wipe across the line as Stoinis bangs one in short. No contact
crashed into the covers, the hundred is up in rapid time
width, and top-spin-slapped through the cordon to third man, always over the shot
flicked to the leg side
slower ball, well watched, perfectly slapped, but straight into the non-striker's stumps for the second time today
chiselled into the leg side
worked into the gap
a short-arm pull through midwicket
flicked into the leg side once more, another well placed stroke
dabbed out to cover
speared into the toes, sweetly timed through backward square, but a good sliding stop in the deep cuts off the damage
crashed to cover
on the legs, clipped calmly into space, and up comes the fifty stand
tossed up and defended to the leg side
low full toss, clipped into space on the leg side
slower through the air, a touch loopier, dips into a leg-stump push
clobbered out to cover
drawn down the track, and a late jabbed defensive block works its way to midwicket
gets a little lucky here, splices a pull which loops over mid-on
back of a length at off stump, bunted back to the bowler
short outside off, angled to third man
tucks a straight delivery off the pads through midwicket
short outside off, a flat-batted pull to deep square leg
short of a length outside off, played to point
defends a full ball back to the bowler
opens the face and steers through the off side
plays back to a shorter delivery and pushes down the ground with a straight bat
the googly, pushed into midwicket
bunted to midwicket with a straight bat
length on off stump, pushed to the cover sweeper
short, pulled to deep midwicket
good length outside off, plays it late and it runs off the face towards the keeper
hint of swing in at Root, played off the front foot back to the bowler
that's a nice piece of timing, leans forward into a length delivery and places it straight of mid-on
banged in short, not quite out of the middle as Root pulls to deep midwicket
he's through the pull shot early this time, beaten on the under edge
deep in the crease, whips a straight delivery off the stumps to deep square leg
loses his shape as he uses his feet and aims to whip this away, gets a think inside edge to short fine leg
brings out the reverse sweep, loops square into the off side from a top edge...not sure that's needed
a nicely controlled drive down the ground
full at off stump, swings across the line and gets a thick inside half of the bat to the leg side
plays back and pushes to midwicket
nearly works! Short on leg stump, Roy goes for the pull and gets a top edge which flies just out of Paine's reach
well bowled, another good bumper, Roy sways out of the line
that's gone high into the evening sky, and loops over mid-on then plugs in the outfield...a length delivery which Roy tried to send into the stands
back of a length outside off, Roy adjusts and angles down to third man...he's ticking
short of a length outside off, a sweetly timed square cut but Smith pulls off a brilliant save at backward point
fuller at off stump, tucked into the leg side
full and straight, picks out midwicket
touch wider outside off, driven to cover
tossed up and comes out as a low full toss, costs just a single as Root drives to long-on
strides forward and pushes a full delivery to long-on
dragged down a little short, Root goes onto his back knee and sweeps but finds short fine leg
the bottom hand comes into play as he shovels a full delivery to long-on
full outside off, pushes into the covers
angled into the pads, deflects behind square on the leg side off the pads and the lack of pace in the shot means they can scamper back for a second
short and he connects cleanly with his pull but finds Marsh just in front of square
touch of width outside off, drives on the up square to deep point
short at off stump, rolls his wrists and pulls to long leg
tries to ramp this short delivery down to third man but is beaten by the bounce
tucked off the pads to deep square leg
takes a skip down the pitch then flicks to midwicket
that comes out a little wrong, very wide outside off
short of a length, pushed down the ground to long-on
steps back and drives to deep cover
full at middle and leg, pushed firmly to midwicket
nudged off the pads behind square on the leg side
pushed into the pads, deflects wide of the keeper
a slower ball, dug in, Root can only pull to midwicket
another slower delivery, short outside off, angled down to third man
he goes after this one, short of a length outside off, pulled high over midwicket but not timed especially well and stops on the outfield...came from high on the bat
good length at the stumps, defended into midwicket
good length, angled to backward point with an open face
a full toss outside off, Root opts for the leg side and slog-sweeps to deep midwicket without much timing

he's done him with the googly! Given lbw. Lovely piece of bowling, but Roy is reviewing. Only thing that can save him is if he's hit outside the line. Impact is outside the line! He got his knee just far enough forward
just clears long-on! A dramatic few minutes...he uses his feet, opts for the aggressive route, launches it down the ground with just enough legs
the slider, Roy not picking him, defended to cover
nice bowling, nearly does him in length, defended to midwicket
tossed up, dips late, almost a yorker and takes a thick inside edge into the boot...tension, tension. Zampa bowling very nicely
full at off stump, 115kph slower ball, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, drop-and-run into the leg side

there's his hundred! Short outside off, he's across the crease and pulls through midwicket and it's enough for three figures. A super innings, electrifying in the first fifty and he's consolidated since
good length outside off, driven to cover
short of a length, straight, worked into the leg side
full at off stump, flicked to long-on
full, straight, nails his reverse sweep this time, deep point can't get across
full and straight, flicked wide of the diving midwicket
very full, dug out down the ground to long-on
another googly, pitches wide outside off, dabbed to short third man
a full toss, a flat-batted swat along the ground through midwicket with the placement to beat the deep fielders
full and straight, pushed down the ground...an expensive over from Zampa
full outside off, gets forward and drives to deep cover to reach a very controlled 59-ball fifty
good length, angled in at the stumps, tucked to the right of mid-on
a slower ball, full outside off, opens the face and it's cut off at backward point
right up at the toes, dug out to the covers
chopped into the ground to backward point
beats him a with a yorker, just wide of off stump, Root plays over the top of it...good comeback over from Starc
swing and a miss! Good length outside off, Roy aims to go down the ground
back of a length outside off, driven firmly just to the left of mid-off
full and straight, flicked to midwicket
full at off stump, a bottom-handed flick to mid-on
bang! That's brute force from Roy, back of a length outside off, clubbed straight down the ground and long-on Finch, dives over the top of it
skews off a thickish outside edge to deep cover
that's tough for Starc! Round the wicket, speared in full at leg stump, Roy gets an inside edge through his legs...the Nat-Meg?
that's a wild swing, short of a length outside off, Roy had his eyes on the stands at deep square
another short one, a slower ball, Roy spots it and bails out of any attempt to play...goes second bounce to Paine
fuller length, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, angled in at Roy, cramps him for room and loops back down the pitch towards Starc
aims for the leg-stump yorker again, not a million miles, but it's clipped behind square and long leg can't stop the second
gets over the top of a short delivery and pulls to long leg
that's through him, short, Roy going for a pull
back of a length on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
walks across the crease and flicks this from outside off to deep midwicket
short of a length, he goes for a whip-pull, gets a bottom edge into the pads which loops through to Paine who makes a good stop but they steal the run...actually, no edge
that's well played, not a great ball though with this field, short on leg stump and Roy pulls it over short fine leg
stays round the wicket, back of a length at off stump, pushed to backward point
gone with a hit! Gets behind a short ball, knocks into the off side, Smith fields from backward point and he would have been short
full at the stumps, heaved over the leg side, one bounce to deep square leg...runs required under 100
full, angled in at the pads, clipped along the ground to deep midwicket
short outside off, Roy gets right across the crease and pulls strongly through midwicket...top placement
short again, another pulls, this time it's more a bottom edge that dribbles to deep square
back of a length, battered with alacrity out to deep midwicket, where the ball is well hauled back by a headlong dive towards the rope
clipped on the up through mid-on, an easy strike-manoeuvring single
hammered high and hard, out to deep midwicket... who's out there? No-one! The ball plugs safe and Roy marches on!
bat and pad together, poking the googly out to gully, as Root scampers through ahead of the shy
reverse-sweep, top-edged, but just short of gully.... he's living dangerously!
too short, hoisted and that's more handsome! Clean over the ropes at wide long-on, to end a probing over with a dismissive thwack!
tapped into the covers
on the toes, clipped to leg
banged in short, a looping slower ball
pushed back into the crease, clipped to the leg side for another sharp single
outside off, a swing and a miss
crikey, Roy tries to drop his gloves on a lifter, finds the inside splice, and loops a curious backwards cut down to fine leg. They all count
stretching forward to defend, pushed back down the pitch
sliding down the leg side, a big swish distracts the keeper, and a thin bottom edge adds to the tallly
a loose and wafty drive as Zampa dangles it outside off
and up comes the 150... barely acknowledged though, he's got bigger fish to fry
another loose wipe, losing a bit of shape at this late stage of his innings
hasty defence, kept out with a flurry of limbs, and another stolen single to leg side
short, pulled, wrists rolling over the ball as the shot rolls out to deep square leg
up on the toes, punched to cover
banged in short, out to deep midwicket
clipped on the up through mid-on
wide and glided through backward point
bouncer, well directed, Roy walked right inside the line as the ball passed over the top of middle stump
twisting down the leg side, a rank half-tracker and helped round the corner with a languid pull
forward and pushed to the off side
dancing feet to defend
forward and pushed to the off side
high and mighty! Into the floodlights, down into the stands! Tossed up, tempting England's main man, and he was tempted alright!
tip and run into the covers, and what excellent running to turn one into two. He's matched his previous best against Sri Lanka at The Oval
chiselled out to the leg side
low full toss, squeezed out to point, excellently grabbed at point and the shy hits the non-striker's stumps as Root scampers for the crease
kneeling into a crunching front-foot drive, into the off side
short again, slammed again, up and over the leg side. He is monumentally in the zone!
on the pads, tucked to the leg side, another scampered single
low full toss, squeezed out to point
back of a length, tapped to midwicket to draw level with Alex Hales as England's highest scorer in ODIs!
on the pads, whipped square and finds the gap with ease to jog back for the second
full length, clipped to leg. Simple pickings
heave ho! Roy eyes up the massive mow but the line is a touch too wide. A big golf drive down an imaginary fairway
battered on the up, just out of the reach of cover, and Roy is England's highest scorer in ODIs!
worked to leg once more
round the wicket, attacking the blockhole, dug out to cover
short, pulled, well stopped on the fine leg boundary with an opportune dive from Zampa
into line to defend
walking across the stumps, picks it up off middle and leg to flick another single to Zampa at fine leg
forward, driven to cover
worked to leg once again, that's been a bread-and-butter single all innings long
outside off, very full, stabbed through third man
short and wide, cracked on the up but not timed. Matters not, as it plugs safe in the covers, well short of the boundary riders
width, attempted square drive, nearly finds the edge!
low full toss, crunched into the gap, all along the ground. Easy as you like
nudged off the legs
fewer bothers middling his drives though, another wristy tonk into the covers
tapped through mid-off and there's another well-judged single
round the wicket, very full length, punched into the covers

short, pulled, top-edged, gone! The end of a triumphant innings from Roy, the MCG rises as one to a brilliant performance. A bit of a tired ending, went for the big humpty over the leg side, but ended up with a lobbed chance to backward square. But what a statement innings from a resurgent one-day team!
full again, driven hard to point
round the wicket, into the toes, another single to cover
over the wicket, dabbed back down the track to welcome the new man, England's captain
angled into the pads, clipped behind square to nibble ever closer to the target
on the gallop, and misses with a mow outside off! Easy now...
short and battered out through square leg
fully into line to defend
opens the face to defend out to point
a hop-chop, out through backward point
hurried on a good length, defended on the back foot with one hand coming loose
short and hoisted out to deep square leg
dabbed through third man, waiting for the ball to arrive
short, wide, and carved to point! Oops! Is this England's late dose of the wobbles? Probably too little too late, but you never rightly know...
banged in short, too short for the umpire's liking
short and thumps the gloves. Good aggression in adversity
tapped out to point. The patient still has a pulse
tapped into the gap
short and sharp, good intent from Tye, who is not going without a fight
solidly into line
thumped to the leg side
outswinging slower-ball yorker. Not a bad nut to produce at the best of times. Beats Root all ends up outside off
slower ball again, swings late, met with a compact drive to cover
another single, chipping the deficit away
lifting into the gloves, that's a sharp delivery, keeping England honest
fuller length, picks the gap this time with a thumping drive, splitting the covers, and handing the strike back to the more settled Root
short and aggressive, targetting the head, but pulled down to backward square to keep the runs ticking
short and through to the keeper
short and sharp again, Australia defending this match with aggression and tenacity, but they are already several fathoms underwater
cracked straight to cover
in the arc, and tonked over the bowler to bring England to within a solitary boundary
on the toes, that could have been it, but Finch at short midwicket wears the shot on his shin. Ouch
outside off, dabbed into the off side for another sharp single
launched into the leg side for the winning runs ... but no! It's a top-edge to deep midwicket!
drilled hard to cover. Another dot...
nicely flighted, into the blockhole
dabbed into the gap for a single
a bottom-handed bunt down to long-on, and the scores are level
a yawning mow from Mo! Lucky not to lose his poles. Careful now
battered through long-on, and England win by five wickets!
